storyInfo: Just as the hunt is about to draw to an end, Amaia intervenes and stops Specter. The Seaborn successfully returns to the ocean and awaits evolution, and Kal'tsit and Carmen, who just embarked on their journey, do not know whether they'll make it in time.

attributes.content: You wasted your chance.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: If I were you, when I caught that talking Seaborn in Sal Viento, I would've forced it to spill everything it knew about Ægir.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You've been walking the land for years. You've never heard Ægir's messages. But the ocean is different. The ocean has never been disconnected.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Yet you simply allowed it to die without creating any value. An unproductive decision, Gladiia.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I don't need to hear messages from trash. The only answers our prey can provide are the grunts of lowly beasts.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Seems you've found some assistants on land. And put quite a bit of trust in them.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: (Howls) The cosmos... cemetery...
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: You're showing mercy. Why does he still stand?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...I'm not.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: He's just a little sturdier than anticipated.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The knight does not fight back. He suddenly freezes in place and throws his head back. He staggers, spins around, and looks up.
Gladiia had planned to seize this moment to put an end to the chase, but right as she is about to, she has a faint premonition.
The Seaborn's scent. It's changed.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You're already sensitive enough to notice such changes then?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: That's right, Gladiia.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: No matter how much you try to console yourself or others, this is a problem we'll have to deal with, sooner or later, ourselves.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Garcia!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Sobbing howl)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Good... Good... You hurt it real bad! We'll track it down in no time by following these blood trails.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Wait, what are these burn marks? What did it do to my ship?!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The monster can't have left these marks behind.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: That's right. It must be the masterwork of our lovely little Iberian bird. Aw, they grow up so fast.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: So who's scarier? The Seaborn or her people?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...You mean the Iberian from before? Her? Impossible. Any of this ship's battle-hardened sailors would've been stronger than her. How could SHE do this?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Nibbles on the captain's sleeves)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: ...I understand.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: No matter. Regardless of what that Iberian did, we have to hurry.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Time to put an end to this months-long hunt.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: You seem to be in a pretty good mood, Mister Captain.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Good mood? Hah!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Who wouldn't be happy to bring an end to such a long hunt?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: You keep chasing. I'll go a different way. It won't cut through these walls, it'll try to get closer to the sea.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Garcia... Your wounds aren't life-threatening. Just hang in there, and we'll be right back!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The injured chief mate still needs more time to recover. It looks at its captain's face in silence.
Joy. A hard-to-disguise excitement. A vigor it has not felt in a long time.
It takes a peaceful nap, focusing its energy on rejuvenating its injured parts. All to help its lover continue the hunt.
A brief, light dream. Short, trance-like, and extremely rare since its body underwent such profound changes.
In its dream, it stands upon Iberia's shores. The sky booms with fireworks and hums with the din of whistles. A high-spirited Alfonso stands at its side, asking it a question.
Garcia.
See those kids along the shore? We all like children.
Children are the future of Iberia. Our glory, our feats, and our skills all die with us.
But children. New lives. Ones that all of Iberia will come together to nurture. And they'll inherit it all.
Garcia.
Who do you think he should take after?
(How can it still move so fast with those injuries? I can't keep up!)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (And... holding back from firing my handcannon is...)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Ugh!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The nethersea brand has spread to the ship? But how?! It wasn't this bad a little while ago!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The fluorescing nethersea brand has devoured the golden Iberian hall.
The intricate dome reflects a ghastly blue light. And amidst the glow stands a lone, out-of-place woman.

Her two hands are crossed in front of her as she silently and carefully sizes up the throne in front of her. The nethersea brand spreads from beneath her feet, sapping the very color from the golden floor.
She turns her head. Her eyes hold nothing but compassion and expectation.
...Good evening, Irene.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: (A Church of the Deep cultist!)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Did I miss...?! No, there's no way!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Originium Arts?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: That's right, Irene. If Dario could see you now, I'm sure he'd be so proud.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: —How do you know our names? Who are you?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I am a translator.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You think a lie like that will do you any good?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I never lie, Irene. I've translated a great many works. Perhaps one of novels full of Gaulish critical realism on your shelves contains my touch? Have you ever even noted the name of the translator?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Look at your feet! You're the one who brought the nethersea brand?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: That's a somewhat biased statement. I did not bring the brand. Rather, I established a bond with the fluorescent sea.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Truly, it is an honor to be a part of it.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: How did you get to this ship?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: That doesn't matter, Irene.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Nor does it matter whether you can defeat the Seaborn, whether I die here, or whether this ship will be key to reconnecting with Ægir. None of that matters.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: And yes... The sacrifices of Dario and the Penal Battalion, Gran Faro's collapse, the Eye of Iberia. The long, long time that has passed...
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: In the vast process of evolutionary transformation, all of these are but drops of water in the sea of life.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: My respect comes from the fact that we are all but a part of the Cycle. Compared to the whole, we are all insignificant.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: —Wait. You mentioned the High Inquisitor. What happened to him...?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Alas, poor Irene. Look, I know the feeling of having questions and needing answers, but is this really the time? When your enemy stands right before you?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: What happened to him?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: His sacrifice was in vain, Irene.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: The sea breeze brought me news of his death. You have my condolences.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Impossible... It can't be...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Nothing is impossible, Irene.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: When the oracle descended, all the futures of this land were set in stone.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: We are bugs crawling along the ground. We ought to follow the ordained path. What's wrong with choosing a life without barriers, without separation, without country and without form?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: If you choose to cease resisting, all the better. If not—
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: —If none of this really matters, Amaia, then why are you buying time for our wounded little prey?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You've woken up, Laurentina.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Not completely, but I can at least remember your name. Hope I'm not coming across as rude.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Irene!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What did you do to her?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Nothing. We were only making small talk.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Skadi, continue the chase.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Wasn't it your prey?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: And who was it that let me run into such a nostalgic figure?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Alright, be careful.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Irene?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: ...You're lying.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The breath of the sea does not lie.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: No, like I said, that's impossible.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The High Inquisitor's death must have had a purpose. The Inquisition never makes sacrifices in vain.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: If you don't believe that, cultist, then... I'll just have to become that purpose.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: So be it. What a resilient child you are.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Ugh!
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Hunter, let's go!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Oh, my dear little Irene, you've only just learned to control the power of an Inquisition handcannon, and this is how you display it?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: If you continue trying to burn the nethersea brand in such a crude manner, Captain Alfonso will be furious, no?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Well... no matter.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You're going to just let them walk away?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Alas, unlike Quintus, I am not in such a hurry. Why would I want to face two Hunters at once and cut my life even shorter?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Is there a difference between a moment and an instant?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: There isn't, but seeing you revert to your old temperament sure brings me back, Laurentina. After all, you were in a coma until the first experiment began.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: How have you been since you left us?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Specter's lips curl into a subtle smile.
It is the most beautiful smile she's shown tonight.
It's getting faster!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I've already... *pant*... put two more holes in it. Just how much blood can it have in there?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Two? How did you...?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I'll tell you later. I don't think my stamina is going to last much longer—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: —It's been cannibalizing its own kind this whole time! No wonder!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Watch out, it's coming at us!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: —Urgh!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Ishar-mla, where is He?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Answer. I wish to know.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You monster!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Before Irene can fire her handcannon, the Seaborn lurches forward.
As the wall cracks audibly, Skadi leaps back with tremendous force, before closing the gap between her and the Seaborn almost instantly.
Her lethal strikes once again bite down on thin air.
What...?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: (None of her hits landed?!)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Insufficient.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Nutrients. Time. All insufficient.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ishar-mla, we require answers. But, I can feel His presence.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: With words, we shall implore.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ishar-mla, even if He does not answer, it does not mean, He is not there.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Even if He is not there, it does not mean, that our kind, has lost its way.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Our kind, has found its way. We will, seize our own fate.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Survival, the primary goal.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Do all of you love rambling on while trying to kill us?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Don't overthink this, and don't plan on returning to the ocean either!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: —Insufficient, far from enough.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: But, soon.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ugh—! Cover your ears! Irene!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Huh? Ah!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Screeching howl) —!
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Rasping murmur) —Roci—nante—
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: (Brays)
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: The waves are coming. We wait for them. We will wait outside. With weapons, we tear them— Let us go!
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: (Echoing braying)
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: The Seaborn's murmurs can be heard from afar. Gladiia frowns slightly.
For an ordinary land-walker to recklessly make contact with the ocean and win eternal madness is certainly conceivable.
But what of the other Seaborn that obeyed him?
But Gladiia does not think about it too deeply. Because a nauseating premonition is gnawing at her nerves—
—It makes her neck itch.
What's happening up there?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This ship has been adrift at sea for more than sixty years.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: If they'd wanted to do away with it, or even simply treated it and its crew as enemies, the Stultifera Navis would've sunk long ago.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: ...So instead, they're assimilating it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: They've treated the ship as a part of their environment. For whatever reason, they must've allowed it to survive in their waters.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: But now, the situation has changed.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You mean...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Hmm.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The nethersea brand? Since when? And how did it spread this quickly?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This ship will most certainly sink.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Gladiia.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Have you ever considered why an Ægir as talented as Breogan chose, in his final hour, to design the key the way he did?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: It should've unlocked the secrets Ægir has long dreamed of. It is the quintessence of his life's work.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: So why is just anyone's blood enough to activate it? Why would he let it fall into the hands of a frail knight?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: We did silence that thing. But they probably don't need any gods at all. Only humanity, in their impotence and hypocrisy, would fold their hands together and pray to the ocean, finding far too much solace within it.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: We need to make use of what little time we have, Gladiia.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You're still thinking about the incident with Thiago.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Mm, not quite. Of all the tragedies I've endured, his is hardly worth mentioning. Nothing more than a grain of sand on the beach.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But how much sand does this beach require?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: This ship wasn't brought by the Penal Battalion. Most of the town's vessels were brought under their supervision, and the few that weren't were... forgotten, stranded along the shore.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Then we've saved quite a bit of time thanks to someone's carelessness.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I can't help but think of how much more will be forgotten, what else will be stranded.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, if the land of Terra were a ship, what kind of vessel do you think it would be?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We're almost at the Eye of Iberia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...That we are.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen
